set.anatomically: adverb: related to the structure of a living thing
set.apparent: adjective: clearly visible or understood; seeming true, but not necessarily so
set.conifer: noun: a tree with cones and needles; typically an evergreen
set.formative: adjective: giving form; noun: an element that gives form
set.implement: noun: a piece of equipment used for a specific purpose; (v.) put a plan into effeect
set.incendiary: adjective: [of a device or attack] designed to cause fire
set.parameter: noun: a value or characteristic that defines a particular system
set.qualm: noun: an uneasy feeling of doubt, worry, or fear, especially about one's own conduct; a misgiving
set.tribulation: noun: a cause of great trouble or suffering or the state of suffering
set.brusque: adjective: abrupt or offhand in speech or manner
set.felicitous: adjective: well chosen or suited to the circumstances; pleasing and fortunate
set.impetuous: adjective: acting quickly without thought or care; moving forcefully or rapidly
set.mercurial: adjective: [of a person] subject to sudden changes of mood or mind
set.querulous: adjective: complaining in a petulant or whining manner
set.smug: adjective: having an excessive pride in oneself or one's achievements
set.supine: adjective: [of a person] lying face upward; failing to act as a result of moral weakness
